Package com.group13.tmae.service.Impl

Class TournamentServiceImpl

java.lang.Object
com.group13.tmae.service.Impl.TournamentServiceImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
TournamentService
@Service
public class TournamentServiceImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements TournamentService
Service implementation for managing tournaments. Provides methods to create, retrieve, update, and delete tournaments, as well as to manage tournament participation and brackets.

      Retrieves a paginated list of tournaments, sorted based on specified criteria.
      Specified by:

      Parameters:

      pageSize - The number of items per page.
      sortField - The field by which the results should be sorted.
      sortDirection - The sorting direction, either "asc" (ascending) or "desc" (descending).
      Returns:
      A Page object containing the paginated list of Tournament objects.

    • joinTournament

      public void joinTournament​(Athlete athlete, Tournament tournament)
      Registers an athlete for a given tournament. If the athlete is already registered, a message is printed indicating so.
      Specified by:
      joinTournament in interface TournamentService
      Parameters:
      athlete - The athlete to register.
      tournament - The tournament for which to register the athlete.

    • leaveTournament

      public void leaveTournament​(Athlete athlete, Tournament tournament)
      Withdraws an athlete from a given tournament. If the athlete is not registered for the tournament, a message is printed indicating so.
      Specified by:
      leaveTournament in interface TournamentService
      Parameters:
      athlete - The athlete to withdraw.
      tournament - The tournament from which to withdraw the athlete.

    • isByeNeeded

      public boolean isByeNeeded​(java.util.List<Athlete> athletes)
      Determines if a bye is necessary for bracket generation based on the number of athletes. A bye is needed if there is an odd number of athletes.
      Specified by:
      isByeNeeded in interface TournamentService
      Parameters:
      athletes - The list of athletes participating in the tournament.
      Returns:
      true if a bye is needed, false otherwise.

    • updateMatch

      public java.lang.Long updateMatch​(java.lang.Long matchID, java.lang.Integer athlete1Score, java.lang.Integer athlete2Score)
      Updates the scores of a specific match.
      Specified by:
      updateMatch in interface TournamentService
      Parameters:
      matchID - The unique identifier of the match to update.
      athlete1Score - The new score to set for the first athlete in the match.
      athlete2Score - The new score to set for the second athlete in the match.
      Returns:
      The unique identifier of the updated match.
      Throws:
      java.lang.RuntimeException - If no match is found with the given ID.

    • recordMatchResult

      @Transactional public void recordMatchResult​(java.lang.Long matchId, java.lang.Long winnerId, java.lang.Long loserId)
      Records the result of a match, updating the winner's and loser's statistics. The match winner is advanced, and the loser is removed from the tournament participants. After updating, it checks if all matches are complete to generate the next round.
      Specified by:
      recordMatchResult in interface TournamentService
      Parameters:
      matchId - The unique identifier of the match.
      winnerId - The unique identifier of the winning athlete.
      loserId - The unique identifier of the losing athlete.

    • checkAndGenerateNextRound

      public void checkAndGenerateNextRound​(Tournament tournament)
      Checks if all matches in the current round are complete and generates the next round of brackets. If an athlete was given a bye in the previous round, they are added back into the participants.
      Specified by:
      checkAndGenerateNextRound in interface TournamentService
      Parameters:
      tournament - The tournament for which to check matches and generate the next round.

    • calculateTotalRounds

      public int calculateTotalRounds​(Tournament tournament)
      Calculates the total number of rounds required for a given tournament based on the number of participants. The method accounts for multiple brackets and the possibility of byes in the tournament structure.
      Specified by:
      calculateTotalRounds in interface TournamentService
      Parameters:
      tournament - The Tournament object for which the total rounds need to be calculated.
      Returns:
      The total number of rounds required for the tournament.
